column4: how can I move all of my /home folder to another directory, and save all my settings and everything, and format the partition (it's on a different partition than my root dir), from a livecd or something, then re-format it as ext3 or something whichever it is now, and put everything back without ubuntu knowing?
I've google a bit and that is all I can do to get rid of hidden truecrypt files
do this to preserve symlinks also http://ubuntu.wordpress.com/2006/01/29/move-home-to-its-own-partition/
using localhost?
yes
try telnet localhost 3389
ctrl-v then z and enter to close
Connected
try just rdesktop localhost 3389
actually it said this Escape char is '^] '
it just shows me the commands I can type
the same things I get when I type --help
localhost:3389?
yeah
I get this "Autoselected keyboard map en-us"
it just sits there, doesn't do anything though, the same way it does when I try to load a program
just for kicks echo $DISPLAY  returns something? :0 ?
it returns :0.0 could it be beryl?  I have aiglx, not on a different server
you could install tightvnc server for windows and vnc in :)

will this still give me the seamless windows?
i doubt it.
I want it to have seamless though, not that I don't appreciate your help
